title: 3 Easy Ways to Make a Community Post on YouTube

steps.title: Navigate to the YouTube website in your web browser.
steps.content: Navigate to the YouTube website in your web browser. If you aren't already logged in, click the profile icon in the top-right corner, then Sign in to do so now. [1] X Research source You must have at least 500 subscribers to create a community post on YouTube. If you have less than 500, you'll need to get more subscribers.

steps.title: Click the "Create" icon at the top-right corner.
steps.content: Click the "Create" icon at the top-right corner. This looks like a camera with a + inside. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Create post.
steps.content: Click Create post . You can also reach this page by going to your channel page and clicking the Community tab.

steps.title: Enter your text.
steps.content: Enter your text. This could be status updates on future videos or links to other social media such as Instagram and Twitter . You can also add an Image , Image Poll , Text Poll , or Video to your post. Click the option you want, then attach the files and/or insert the data for a poll.

steps.title: Click Post.
steps.content: Click Post . This is the button at the bottom-right corner of the post field. If you want to schedule your post for later, click the down arrow next to Post and click Schedule Post . Select a date, time, and time zone to publish the post. Click Schedule . Your community post will be posted.

steps.title: Open the YouTube app on your mobile device.
steps.content: Open the YouTube app on your mobile device. This is the icon of a red rectangle with a white triangle inside. If you aren't already logged in, tap Sign in to do so now, or create a Google account . [2] X Research source YouTube is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store . Be sure your app is updated. You must have an active YouTube channel with at least 500 subscribers to create a community post.

steps.title: Tap the "Create" icon at the top-right corner.
steps.content: Tap the "Create" icon at the top-right corner. On Android, this looks like a camera with a + inside. On iOS, this looks like a circle with a + inside. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Create post.
steps.content: Tap Create post . You can also reach this page by going to your channel page and tapping the Community tab.

steps.title: Enter your text.
steps.content: Enter your text. This could be status updates on future videos or links to other social media such as Instagram and Twitter. You can also add an Image , Image Poll , or Text Poll to your post. Tap the option you want, then attach the files and/or insert the data for a poll. If you want to share a video on mobile, you must go to the video itself and tap Share to post it in the community section.

steps.title: Tap Post.
steps.content: Tap Post . This is the button at the bottom-right corner of the post field. If you want to schedule your post for later, tap the clock icon in the top-right corner. Select a date, time, and time zone to publish the post. Tap Done . Your community post will be posted.

steps.title: Navigate to the YouTube website in your web browser.
steps.content: Navigate to the YouTube website in your web browser. If you aren't already logged in, click the profile icon in the top-right corner, then Sign in to do so now. You can only manage your community posts on a computer. This can't be done on mobile devices.

steps.title: Click ☰ in the top-left corner.
steps.content: Click ☰ in the top-left corner. This will expand the menu. Skip this step if the menu is already visible.

steps.title: Click History.
steps.content: Click History . You'll be taken to a new page.

steps.title: Click Community.
steps.content: Click Community . This is underneath the History type header.

steps.title: Click ⋮ next to the post you want to delete.
steps.content: Click ⋮ next to the post you want to delete. You may need to hover over the post first.

steps.title: Click Delete.
steps.content: Click Delete . This will delete your community post. You can also select Edit if you want to fix a minor mistake.
